newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: POLL - Portugal Jan inflation seen 0.3-0.8 pct.
newsitem.headline: POLL - Portugal Jan inflation seen 0.3-0.8 pct.

text.p: Portuguese consumer price inflation for January is expected to stand in a range between 0.3 and 0.8 percent, compared with 0.3 percent in January 1996, according to eight analysts polled by Reuters.
The National Statistics Institute (INE) plans to announce January inflation figures on Friday.

"In January 1996 there was a significant slowdown in price rises of foodstuffs, especially potatoes, meat and 'eating out'. This trend will not be repeated in January 1997," said Pedro Braz Teixeira of Banco Santander de Negocios Portugal.

A monthly inflation of 0.3 percent, 0.4 percent, 0.5 percent, 0.6 percent and 0.8 percent would give year-on-year inflation of 3.3 percent, 3.4 percent, 3.5 percent, 3.6 percent and 3.8 percent and average annual inflation of 3.2 percent.

In January 1996, year-on-year inflation was 2.5 percent and average annual inflation was 4.0 percent. In December 1996 monthly inflation was 0.1 percent, average inflation was 3.1 percent and year-on-year inflation was 3.3 percent.

Braz Teixeira said: "In 'administered goods' (utilities) we expect a deceleration in 1997, compared with 1996, but in the case of electricity there will be an exception, as prices did not rise in the last two years and will rise by one percent in 1997."
